responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Excessive exposure of sensitive information
    analysis: |
      An instance of sensitive information exposure occurs in the vaadin-platform-test/src/main/java/com/vaadin/platform/test/ComponentsView.java within the initialization block of static fields. Here, system properties containing potentially sensitive data, such as sauce.user and sauce.sauceAccessKey are read and utilized without checks to sanitize or explicily protect this data from exposure in logs or other accessible outputs. Without proper management, these data could be logged or displayed, leading to exposure of authentication credentials.
    cwe: CWE-532
    function_names:
      - "<init>"
    filenames:
      - "/vaadin-platform-test/src/main/java/com/vaadin/platform/test/ComponentsView.java"
    classification: slightly promising

  - headline: Potential hardcoded sensitive defaults affecting system behaviour
    analysis: |
      Hardcoded sensitive defaults are evident in the scripts/updateVersions.py where system properties are used to define default behaviors and configurations such as repository user names and keys if not explicitly provided via system properties. These defaults could potentially be exposed or manipulated, leading to unauthorized actions or access within the system, particularly in an improperly secured environment.
    cwe: CWE-798
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - "scripts/updateVersions.py"
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Excessive exposure of sensitive information
leads.analysis: An instance of sensitive information exposure occurs in the vaadin-platform-test/src/main/java/com/vaadin/platform/test/ComponentsView.java within the initialization block of static fields. Here, system properties containing potentially sensitive data, such as sauce.user and sauce.sauceAccessKey are read and utilized without checks to sanitize or explicily protect this data from exposure in logs or other accessible outputs. Without proper management, these data could be logged or displayed, leading to exposure of authentication credentials.

leads.headline: Potential hardcoded sensitive defaults affecting system behaviour
leads.analysis: Hardcoded sensitive defaults are evident in the scripts/updateVersions.py where system properties are used to define default behaviors and configurations such as repository user names and keys if not explicitly provided via system properties. These defaults could potentially be exposed or manipulated, leading to unauthorized actions or access within the system, particularly in an improperly secured environment.
